After my last message: Downloaded at some awesome rate of a steady 3.3 MB/s and got it after 2 mins.
Quality: AWESOME!

To the people complaining about bitrate and audio lag: 

Get VLC. 

To the guy whining about .mkv files: There's nothing wrong with .mkv, except that a lot of players don't support it. They convert to other formats fine, and they play fine.

@jj41 Wth are you talking about?! You could never achieve the equal amount of quality if he encoded it in .mp4 or .avi, which are both compressed formats while .mkv is completely uncompressed, allowing for maximum quality.

V:8
A:8

Quality is good, but a bit blurry in parts. Audio is also good but seems like its missing bass, or sounds like it was recorded from a speaker
to everyone complaining about .mkv format, .mkv is not a filetype, it's a CONTAINER, the video itself is formatted in MPEG-4.

This is a non-encoded transport stream(.ts). I wrapped it in MKV because more people recognize it. This is the quality Nickelodeon HD broadcasted it at. 

A transport stream(.ts) is a portable copy made from TV turned into an executable data file for PC. I can adjust the bitrate if I want, but choose not to simply due to the enjoyment in quality. I can increase or decrease. I leave it at steady.

If you want to extract the transport stream(.ts) from the MKV container, get MKVToolNix and use MKVExtractGUI to demux and obtain the original file.

for the folks who are having problems with audio syncing. It should be fine, but if its really an issue then 
I say convert to avi, then use the free YAAI program (yet another avi info) and then you can align the audio and video even if its a millisecond apart. I did it for a couple movies and it worked perfectly and was very fast since its not doing any converting or anything
